attributes.action: PARLIAMENT MUST DEBATE THE LEGALITY (UNDER VCLT:1969) OF UK ENTRY INTO THE EU
attributes.additional_details:
Equally no Treaty is valid if people of that State were misled as to the intentions of a treaty.

Article 26, VCLT states that every treaty must be performed in 'good faith'.

It has become apparent with the republication of document FCO 30/1048:71 that Prime Minister Heath, and all subsequent Governments were complicit to a certain extent, when assuring the People and Parliament that there was no question of surrendering national sovereignty.
attributes.background: Article 53, VCLT: 1969 states: 'A treaty is void if, at the time of its conclusion, it conflicts with a peremptory norm of general international law which include secret negotiations, misleading the people of the signature State and failure to conform with the constitution of the signature State.
